metaTags.metaDescription: Learn how Cloudflare integrates seamlessly with multiple identity, endpoint, and cloud providers.

relatedBlades.title: Integrate Zero Trust with ease and flexibility
relatedBlades.subtitle: Cloudflare empowers your organization with flexibility to build on the providers you already use and avoid vendor lock-in.
relatedBlades.copy:
Your existing identity, endpoint, and cloud vendors can too often feel like sandbags weighing down your Zero Trust journey. Cloudflare integrates seamlessly with those prior investments, so they feel like rocket boosters.

Our Zero Trust platform is designed to work with multiple providers at once, so you're never constrained and always in charge of how you advance your security goals.

relatedBlades.subtitle: Platforms with inflexible integrations have hidden, long-term costs
relatedBlades.copy1: Security teams too often spend time pouring over dense technical documentation, while trying to string together tools that were never designed for each other. These overly complex backend integrations are tedious to set up, let alone scale.
relatedBlades.copy2: Some vendors have a vested interest in pulling you deeper into their preferred ecosystem of technologies, whether it is right for your organization or not. Often, this translates to absent support and buggy experiences when working with tools outside their center of gravity.
relatedBlades.copy3: When your security tools don't talk to each other, your organization misses out on crucial context that enhances a [Zero Trust approach](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/security/glossary/what-is-zero-trust/). Without that context, your organization may be blind to emerging threats and leave gaps in policies.

relatedBlades.title: Aggregate context across vendors onto Cloudflare's single control plane
relatedBlades.copy:
Cloudflare takes an agnostic approach to integrations, allowing your organization to onboard multiple of your preferred identity, endpoint, and cloud providers at once. That flexibility makes it easy to keep moving forward with Zero Trust, regardless of your preexisting tech stack. 

In the process, our platform aggregates context and risk signals across those providers, enabling richer intelligence for you to create and enforce more granular security policies across our edge.

image.description: Diagram of Cloudflare's agnostic approach to integrations

imageAssetFile.title: Cloudflare for Teams: Agnostic Approach to Zero Trust Integrations

contentfulAsset.description: Diagram of Cloudflare's agnostic approach to integrations

relatedBlades.title: Frictionless authentication across provider types
relatedBlades.copy:
- Onboard all your corporate identities at once (Okta, Azure AD, and more)
- Federate identities across multiple providers and multiple instances of each provider
- Social identities (LinkedIn or Github) enable faster, easier, and equally secure authentication for third parties

relatedBlades.title: Posture checks across device types
relatedBlades.copy:
- Level up security by integrating with endpoint protection providers (like Crowdstrike, SentinelOne, and more)
- Context-aware access across any device (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, chromeOS, and Android) 
- [Enrich risk assessment](https://www.cloudflare.com/cybersecurity-risk-management/) with our client, optimized for flexible deployment

image.description: Illustration of a laptop and a mobile device with a padlock

contentfulAsset.description: Illustration of a laptop and a mobile device with a padlock

relatedBlades.title: Focus on Zero Trust security, not your cloud consumption
relatedBlades.copy:
- Zero Trust for any resource in public, private, or SaaS cloud environments
- App connectors, network on-ramp partners, and storage integrations to interact with any cloud
- Embrace a multi-cloud future without worrying about vendor lock-in

features.title: Our Zero Trust Integrations
features.description: Cloudflare empowers your organization with flexibility to build on the identity, endpoint protection, and cloud providers you already use and avoid vendor lock-in. Learn how we approach technology integrations and partnerships for our Zero Trust platform.

features.title: Blog: Latest device security partnerships
features.description: In March 2021, Cloudflare announced new integrations with VMware Carbon Black, CrowdStrike, and SentinelOne to pair with our existing Tanium integration. Cloudflare Zero Trust customers can now use these integrations to restrict access to their applications based on security signals from their devices.

features.title: Blog: Latest Network On-ramp partners
features.description: In March 2021, Cloudflare expanded its Network On-ramp partners to span 15 leading connectivity providers in 70 unique locations, making it easier for customers to get their traffic onto our edge.

features.title: Webpage: Technology Partners Overview
features.description: Learn more about how Cloudflare works with leading technology companies across categories to enable flexibility for our customers to build on the solutions they already work with.

features.title: Blog: Zero Trust MDM integrations
features.description: New integrations with mobile device management vendors Microsoft Intune, Ivanti, JumpCloud, Kandji, and Hexnode to make it even easier to deploy and install Cloudflare's device client (WARP).

features.title: Webpage: MDM partnerships
features.description: Cloudflare has partnered with leading MDM solutions to help teams manage their device fleet and progress towards Zero Trust security with ease and agility. Learn more about how to become a partner.
